thread.title: Shock snub: NBA All-Star starters named
thread.title_full: Shock snub: NBA All-Star starters named

title: Shock snub: NBA All-Star starters named
text:
Giannis Antetokounmpo, Milwaukee Bucks 
*** 
The obvious omission from the Western Conference backcourt is Oklahoma City Thunder guard Russell Westbrook, who’s currently averaging a triple-double. Stephen Curry has the advantage of being the more popular player, something that likely gave him an edge in the fan voting. 
PODCAST! Joe Ingles joins this week’s episode of Overtime to talk about the Utah Jazz’s recent success, his own individual improvement, and his plans for NBA All-Star Weekend. 
Subscribe to the podcast on iTunes by CLICKING HERE. 
Curry will be making his fourth All-Star appearance, Harden will make his fifth, and Leonard will make his second. Davis was named to his fourth — his first as a starter — while Durant will feature in his eighth. media_camera LeBron James has been named to his 13th All-Star Game. 
In the Eastern Conference starting lineup, Irving will be making his fourth All-Star appearance, while DeRozan will make his third. James continues his stellar All-Star run with his 13th, Butler is set to make his third, while Antetokounmpo will be making his debut at the NBA’s signature event. 
The reserves for the All-Star game will be selected by coaches, and will be announced on January 27th (AEDT).
